CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1959, pg. A14 reads: "Club Of Young Matrons - The Colloquim Club is composed of a group of young matrons, organized 14 years ago as a benevolent society. During the years the group has presented sheets and pillow cases to the Harriet Tubman Guild to the Aged Ministers and Laymen's Home, and Camp Achievement.  Presenting a gift to Louise Pendleton of the Guild are Marie O'Neal, social chairman; Mary Pendleton, secretary; Jennie Baker, president, and MRs. Pendleton.  Standing are Mayolla Jordon, Orphelia Hopson, Elizabeth Goodson, Hilda Strawbridge and Rezelia Banks, secretary. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of Colloquim Club, seated: Marie O'Neal, Louise Pendleton of Harriet Tubman Guild receiving gift, Mary Pendleton, and Jennie Baker; standing: Mayolla Jordon, Orphelia Hopson, Elizabeth Goodson, Hilda Strawbridge, and Rezelia Banks, gathered in interior with television, linoleum floor, and graphic patterned curtains
